titleStmt.title: William C.F. Martz v. J.H. Whitcourt. Writ

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: William Martz v. J.H. Whitcourt. Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In the District Court of the 2nd Ju- dicial District Territory of Washington holding terms at Kalama in and for Pacific County in said District.
In the matter of the application of Wm C.F. Martz for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
To the Honorable Roger S. Green, Judge of said Court.

Your petitioner Wm C.F. Martz a citizen of the United States, respect- fully showed unto your Honor that he is restrained of his liberty in the town of Oysterville in Pacific County Washington Territory in said District by James H. Whitcourt.

That the cause or pretense of the restraint according to the best of the knowledge and belief of your petitioner is a certain paper writing signed by one George W. Wilson, Justice of the Peace for the Precinct of Bruceport in said Pacific County purporting to be a commitment, a copy of which is hereunto attached and made a part hereof.

That said restraint is illegal in this that said paper writing is not a legal commitment. That said Geo. W. Wilson Justice of the Peace as aforesaid had no authority by law to issue any warrant or commitment to the Sheriff of said County or any other officer. That there is no Judgment in authorizing the imprisoning of your petitioner. That there never was any jurisdiction vested in said Justice to make any order of Com- mitment of your petitioner.

Wherefore your petitioner prays your Honor to grant unto him the most gracious Writ of Habeas Corpus commanding said J.H. Whit- Court to produce your petitioner before your Honor at such time and place as shall be appointed by your Honor and that enquiring may be made of and concerning said restraint that Justice may be done your petitioner in the premises.
Dated at Oysterville, Pacific County, W.T. this 10th day of February A.D. 1876.
Wm. C.F. Martz
United States of America Territory of Washington Pacific County } ss
I Wm. C.F. Martz, being duly sworn, say that I am the petitioner in the foregoing petition named and that the facts in said petition, stated and that said petition is true.
Wm. C.F. Martz
Subscribed and sworn to this 10th day of February A.D. 1876. H.K. Stevens Noltary Public Washington Territory
2nd Jud. Dist. Ct. Territory of Washington
In the matter of the application of W.F. C. Martz for Writ of Habeas Corpus
Petition
O.F. Bill Atty for Martz
Let a writ issue as prayed 1st Thursday in March at by Dated 17 Feby 76.
Field in District Court Feby 18 1876 Joseph H Coughton
By H H Holt Clerk
